chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
T: poset
s: chain T
M: monotone id

Goal:
[id^^sbyM] = s

Premises:
monotone : forall T1 T2 : poset, (T1 -> T2) -> Prop
Notation id := (fun x => x)
Record chain (T : poset) : Type := Chain { pred_of : Pred T; _ : chain_axiom pred_of } Arguments Chain [T pred_of]
app_mono : forall x : ?A, monotone (@^~ x) where ?A : [T : poset s : chain T M : monotone id |- Type] ?T : [T : poset s : chain T M : monotone id |- poset]
dapp_mono : forall x : ?A, monotone (@^~ x) where ?A : [T : poset s : chain T M : monotone id |- Type] ?T : [T : poset s : chain T M : monotone id |- ?A -> poset]
image_chain : forall T1 T2 : poset, chain T1 -> forall f : T1 -> T2, monotone f -> chain T2
image_chainP : forall (T1 T2 : poset) (s : chain T1) (f : T1 -> T2), monotone f -> chain_axiom [Pred x2 | exists x1 : T1, x2 = f x1 /\ x1 \In s]
chainE : forall (T : poset) (s1 s2 : chain T), s1 = s2 < -> s1 =p s2
comp_mono = fun (T1 T2 T3 : poset) (f1 : T2 -> T1) (f2 : T3 -> T2) (M1 : monotone f1) (M2 : monotone f2) (x y : T3) (H : x <== y) => M1 (f2 x) (f2 y) (M2 x y H) : forall (T1 T2 T3 : poset) (f1 : T2 -> T1) (f2 : T3 -> T2), monotone f1 -> monotone f2 -> monotone (f1 \o f2) Arguments comp_mono {T1 T2 T3} {f1 f2}%function_scope
prop_sup = fun s : Pred Prop => exists p : Prop, p \In s /\ p : Pred Prop -> Prop
pred_of : forall T : poset, chain T -> Pred T
tarski_gfp_fixed : forall (T : lattice) (f : T -> T), monotone f -> f (tarski_gfp f) = tarski_gfp f
tarski_lfp_fixed : forall (T : lattice) (f : T -> T), monotone f -> f (tarski_lfp f) = tarski_lfp f
id_mono = fun (T : poset) (x y : T) => id : forall T : poset, monotone id Arguments id_mono {T}
Chain : forall (T : poset) (pred_of : Pred T), chain_axiom pred_of -> chain T
sup_closed = fun T : lattice => [Pred s | forall d : Pred_Class, d <=p s -> sup d \In s] : forall T : lattice, Simpl_Pred (Pred T) Arguments sup_closed {T}
sub_sup : forall (T : lattice) (s : Pred T), sup_closed s -> Pred (subPoset s) -> subPoset s
infP : forall (T : lattice) (s : Pred_Class) (x : T), x \In s -> inf s <== x
supP : forall (T : lattice) (s : Pred T) (x : T), x \In s -> x <== sup s
const_mono = fun (T1 T2 : poset) (y : T2) (x y0 : T1) => fun=> poset_refl y : forall (T1 T2 : poset) (y : T2), monotone (fun=> y) Arguments const_mono {T1 T2 y}
diag_mono = fun (T : poset) (x y : T) (H : x <== y) => conj H H : forall T : poset, monotone (fun x : T => (x, x)) Arguments diag_mono {T}
sub_supX : forall (T : lattice) (s : Pred T), sup_closed s -> forall u : Pred (subPoset s), sub_sup' u \In s
prop_supM : forall (s : Pred Prop) (p : propPoset), (forall q : Prop, q \In s -> q <== p) -> prop_sup s <== p
infM : forall (T : lattice) (s : Pred_Class) (x : T), (forall y : T, y \In s -> x <== y) -> x <== inf s
supM : forall (T : lattice) (s : Pred T) (x : T), (forall y : T, y \In s -> y <== x) -> sup s <== x
LatticeMixin : forall (T : poset) (mx_sup : Pred T -> T), (forall (s : Pred T) (x : T), x \In s -> x <== mx_sup s) -> (forall (s : Pred T) (x : T), (forall y : T, y \In s -> y <== x) -> mx_sup s <== x) -> Lattice.mixin_of T
Mem = fun (T : Type) (pT : PredType T) => nosimpl (let '@PropPredType _ Pred_Sort0 toPred s as pT0 := pT return (pT0 -> Mem_Pred T) in let '@exist _ _ mem _ as s0 := s return (PropPredType s0 -> Mem_Pred T) in mem) : forall (T : Type) (pT : PredType T), pT -> Mem_Pred T Arguments Mem {T}%type_scope {pT}
ideal_supM : forall (T : lattice) (P : T) (s : Pred (ideal P)) (p : idealPoset P), (forall q : ideal P, q \In s -> q <== p) -> ideal_sup s <== p
subLattice : forall (T : lattice) (s : Pred T), sup_closed s -> lattice
dfun_supP : forall (A : Type) (B : A -> lattice) (s : Pred (dfunPoset (fun x : A => B x))) (p : dfunPoset (fun x : A => B x)), p \In s -> p <== dfun_sup s
Record mixin_of (T : poset) : Type := Mixin { mx_sup : Pred T -> T; _ : forall (s : Pred T) (x : T), x \In s -> x <== mx_sup s; _ : forall (s : Pred T) (x : T), (forall y : T, y \In s -> y <== x) -> mx_sup s <== x } Arguments Lattice.Mixin [T] [mx_sup]%function_scope (_ _)%function_scope
subLatticeMixin : forall (T : lattice) (s : Pred T), sup_closed s -> Lattice.mixin_of (subPoset s)
uniq = fun T : eqType => fix uniq (s : seq T) : bool := match s with | [::] => true | x :: s' => (x \notin s') && uniq s' end : forall T : eqType, seq T -> bool Arguments uniq {T} _%seq_scope

```coq
unfold id at 1.
rewrite <- (image_chainP T T s id M).
apply chainE.
unfold pred_of.
apply prop_supM.
intros x Hx.
unfold id in Hx.
rewrite Hx.
apply supP.
Qed.
```

original: unfold id at 1. rewrite <- (image_chainP T T s id M). apply chainE. unfold pred_of. apply prop_supM. intros x Hx. unfold id in Hx. rewrite Hx. apply supP.
